intro: Harpalyce sousae, commonly known as the Socotra harpalyce, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its unique, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Harpalyce sousae thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to the harsh climate of its native habitat. Its ecological significance lies in its role as a keystone species in the unique flora of Socotra.
